title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: Does the expression match any of these formats: $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x$$ + $$b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x+b\right)}^2$$, $${\left(a x\right)}^2-2a b x+b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x-b\right)}^2$$ ? Yes.

title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: In this case, we can see that $$9n^2+30n+25$$ as $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x+b^2={\left(ax+b\right)}^2$$ where $$ax=3n$$ and $$b=5$$. We can factor $$9n^2+30n+25$$ as $${\left(3n+5\right)}^2$$.

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then x $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or x $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or x $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(3n+5\right)}^2=8$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$3n+5=\sqrt{8}$$ and $$3n+5=-\sqrt{8}$$.

title: Solve for n in $$3n+5=\sqrt{8}$$
text: What is n when $$3n+5=\sqrt{8}$$? Simplify the square root as much as possible.

title: Solve for n in $$3n+5=-\sqrt{8}$$
text: What is n when $$3n+5=-\sqrt{8}$$? Simplify the square root as much as possible.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$9n^2+30n+25=8$$ has two solutions which are $$n=\left(-\frac{5}{3}\right)+\frac{2}{3} \sqrt{2}$$ and $$n=\left(-\frac{5}{3}\right)-\frac{2}{3} \sqrt{2}$$.
